qas.question: Norfolk Island inhabitants and visitors don't pay what?
Who is the Chief Minister of Norfolk Island?
What reason did David Buffett give for Norfolk Island surrendering its' tax-free status?

answers.text: for a financial bailout from the federal government

qas.question: When will income tax be introduced on Norfolk Island?
What type of services were Norfolk Island inhabitants unable to receive prior to this announcement?
What do Norfolk Island inhabitants and visitors always pay?

plausible_answers.text: for a financial bailout from the federal government

qas.question: What reason did David Buffett give for Norfolk Island keeping its' tax-free status?
When will income tax be removed by Norfolk Island?
What type of services were Norfolk Island inhabitants unable to receive after this announcement?

context: Residents of Norfolk Island do not pay <a0_0><b5_0>Australian federal taxes<b5_0/><a0_0/>, creating a tax haven for locals and visitors alike. Because there is no income tax, the island's legislative assembly raises money through an import duty, fuel levy, medicare levy, GST of 12% and local/international phone calls. In a move that apparently surprised many islanders the Chief Minister of Norfolk Island, <a1_0><b6_0>David Buffett<b6_0/><a1_0/>, announced on 6 November 2010 that the island would voluntarily surrender its tax free status in return <a2_0><b7_0>for a financial bailout from the federal government<b7_0/><a2_0/> to cover significant debts. The introduction of income taxation will now come into effect on <a3_0><b8_0>July 1, 2016<b8_0/><a3_0/>, with a variation of opinion on the island about these changes but with many understanding that for the island's governance to continue there is a need to pay into the commonwealth revenue pool so that the island can have assistance in supporting its delivery of State government responsibilities such as health, education, medicare, and infrastructure. Prior to these reforms residents of Norfolk Island were not entitled to <a4_0><b9_0>social<b9_0/><a4_0/> services. It appears that the reforms do extend to companies and trustees and not only individuals.
